Title: Hierarchical View Integration Supported in Pipelines
EnhancedContent:
Managing complex orchestration workflows can be challenging—especially when jobs are triggered automatically and dependencies span multiple layers. Hierarchical View for Pipelines in Monitoring Hub, is designed to give you complete visibility and control over your pipeline runs.

![Screenshot of Fabric's Monitoring Hub showcasing Upstream and Downstream runs for Pipelines.](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/image-63-1024x609.png)

## Why Hierarchical View Matters

Pipelines often involve multiple jobs that depend on each other. When something goes wrong, understanding the upstream and downstream impact is critical. Without a clear view, troubleshooting can feel like searching for a needle in a haystack.

Hierarchical View solves this by providing a structured, layered representation of your pipeline runs. This means you can:

- **Navigate across layers of jobs:** Seamlessly explore upstream and downstream jobs within a pipeline. No more guessing which job triggered what—everything is mapped out for you.
- **Trace dependencies with confidence:** Quickly locate related jobs and understand how they connect. This visibility helps you identify root causes and prevent cascading failures.

## How It Works

1. **Navigate to Monitoring Hub**: Open the Fabric Monitoring Hub page.

2. **Enable Hierarchical Columns**: In the Column Options, toggle on Upstream and Downstream runs.

![Toggling on Upstream run and Downstream runs from Column Options in the Monitoring Hub page.](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/image-65-1024x609.png)

3. **Explore Your Pipeline Runs**: Once enabled, you’ll see a clear hierarchy of your pipeline runs, showing which jobs triggered others and how they relate.

![Monitoring Hub showing Upstream run and Downstream runs.](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/image-66-1024x617.png)

You can toggle into the Upstream run / Downstream runs of each of your runs. Upstream run details, Downstream runs details, and the Monitoring Hub page are all connected, making navigation easy!

![Upstream run details](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/image-67-1024x264.png)The image above showcases upstream run details. ![Downstream run details](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/image-68-1024x259.png)Downstream run details.

## Benefits of Hierarchical View

Imagine you have a pipeline that refreshes a dataset and then triggers a downstream job to update a dashboard. If the dashboard update fails, Hierarchical View lets you:

- Instantly see that the failure was caused by the downstream job.
- Check whether the upstream dataset refresh completed successfully.
- Drill into details without switching between multiple pages.

### This saves time and reduces operational risk.

- **Faster troubleshooting**: Identify issues and their impact in seconds.
- **Better visibility**: Understand the full picture of your orchestration workflows.
- **Confidence in operations**: Monitor complex pipelines without guesswork.

## Learn More

Ready to try it? Navigate to Monitoring Hub and try Hierarchical View today. For step-by-step guidance, check out our documentation on [How to monitor pipeline runs in Monitoring hub.](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-factory/monitoring-hub-pipeline-runs)
